description: Maximum size of smallest square when a square of side n is tiled with integer sided squares.
references: J.-P. Delahaye, Les inattendus mathematiques, pp. 94 Belin-Pour la Science Paris 2004.
example: a(11)=2 since an 11 X 11 square can be tiled with integer squares of side at least 2 (a 6x6, a 5 X 5, 4 3 X 3's and 6 2 X 2's).
author: _Erich Friedman_
